description: Distance of n-th prime to nearest cube.
formula: For each prime, find the closest cube (preceding or succeeding); subtract, take absolute value.
example: For 179, 125 is the preceding cube, 216 is the succeeding. 179-125 = 54, 216-179 = 37, so the distance is 37.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {p = prime(n); sc = sqrtnint(p, 3); min(p - sc^3, (sc+1)^3 - p);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 05 2014
author: _Enoch Haga_
